news_header: The Trump administration has begun laying off hundreds of FAA employees as part of a cost-cutting initiative following a recent plane collision in Washington DC.
news_original_title: Hundreds fired at aviation safety agency, union says
news_text: The Professional Aviation Safety Specialists union criticized the firings, stating they would worsen understaffing and compromise aviation safety. Affected employees include safety inspectors and maintenance staff. President Trump has also ordered the firing of probationary employees across government agencies, potentially impacting hundreds of thousands. The administration's actions have raised concerns about public safety and trust in aviation.
